snippet: A stronger dollar and an earlier Easter holiday affected sales, but the food company stood by its full-year forecast.
abstract: Kraft Foods reports second-quarter profit of $1.03 billion, or 58 cents a share, up from $976 million, or 55 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter; revenue fell to $13.29 billion from $13.88 billion; stands by its full-year forecast of 5 percent for revenue and at least 9 percent for operating earnings.
lead_paragraph: A stronger dollar and an earlier Easter holiday affected sales, but the food company stood by its full-year forecast.

headline.main: Kraft Keeps Annual Goals Though Sales Are Slower
headline.print_headline: Kraft Keeps Annual Goals Though Sales Are Slower
